oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Oath of allegiance
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This oath of allegiance to the United States was issued to prisoner of war John M. Henry. The paper--proof of loyalty--describes his complexion, hair color, height, and eye color. Henry became Trousdale County Clerk after the war. In comparison to other Civil War prisons, living conditions for Confederate internees at Fort Delaware were good and the death rate low. Most of the prisoners died of smallpox, diarrhea, and malaria.
